description: Throughout human history, the relationships of science and religion, as well as of science and magic, have been complex and often surprising. This course will cover topics ranging from the links between magic and science in the seventeenth century to contemporary anti-science movements.
name: SCI, MAGIC & RELIGION

values.comments: Despite the potential for the course material to be interesting, students said they were disappointed in the class’s disorganization and felt frustrated at times. Assigned readings provided thought-provoking material and ideas, but Professor Kuklick rarely discussed these in class, and respondents noted that her teaching style often left them simply feeling confused.
